Document Structure¶

This module provides utilities to define a document’s basic structure.

class simpletex.document.Document(documentClass='article', size='12pt')[source]¶

Bases: simpletex.base.Environment

A class which manages a LaTeX document.

This class does NOT manage the preamble (imports, newcommand declarations, etc.). The preamble is managed by the simpletex.Preamble class. Upon instantiation, loads the input encoding to UTF-8 and declares the document class.

documentClass
: str
The LaTeX document class name to use.
size
: str
The default font size to use.
class simpletex.document.Section(name)[source]¶

Bases: simpletex.document.Title

Represents a LaTeX section.

name
: str
The section name.
heading = Style[]¶

Section heading style. If formatting is applied, a global section style will be registered, and the ‘titlesec’ package will be imported.

class simpletex.document.Subsection(name)[source]¶

Bases: simpletex.document.Title

Represents a LaTeX subsection.

name
: str
The subsection name.
heading = Style[]¶

Subsection heading style. If formatting is applied, a global subsection style will be registered, and the ‘titlesec’ package will be imported.
